meanings.sent1: The eradication of the virus was a relief to everyone in the community.
meanings.sent2: The eradication of weeds from the garden made it look much neater.
meanings.sent3: After the eradication of the cake at the party, only crumbs were left behind.
meanings.sent4: The eradication of the old building paved the way for a modern skyscraper.
meanings.sent5: The eradication of the enemy's base was a strategic move in the war.

meanings.definition: The act of wiping out or eliminating something completely.
meanings.sent1: The government's eradication of corruption was a step towards a better society.
meanings.sent2: The eradication of pests from the crops increased the harvest yield.
meanings.sent3: The eradication of homework on weekends would make students very happy.
meanings.sent4: The eradication of doubts from her mind brought her peace.
meanings.sent5: The eradication of the old policy was met with mixed reactions from the employees.
